text: In which part of Stockholm did Louis Delavaud wish to install the embassy?

text: Who sold Broms Palace to Louis Delavaud?

answers.description: The Hats (Hattpartiet) and the Caps (Mösspartiet) are two political parties that fought for power in Sweden between 1719 and 1772.

text: Did the baron de Breteuil contribute to the Swedish economy?

text: Where did Desideria spend her last years?

text: Desideria was she the mother of a Swedish king?

answers.description: She was the mother of Oscar I

text: Where was King Karl XIV born?

text: Which academia did Johan Ludvig Peterson join in 1897?

text: Which building on Valhallavägen did Erik Lallerstedt design?

answers.description: The large brick building at KTH was erected between 1914 and 1922

text: Was the Broms Palace built in a new neighborhood?

answers.description: In 1900, the area was a new part of Stockholm and construction was rare.

text: How many children did Gustav Broms have?

answers.description: Gustav Broms had 5 sons who grew up in the palace.

text: In what type of industry did Gustav Broms make his fortune?

answers.description: Gustav made a profit from the exploitation of the ore deposits in Gällivare and Kirunavaara.
